usage: jsonschema [-h] [-i INSTANCES] [-F ERROR_FORMAT] [-o {plain,pretty}] [-V VALIDATOR] [--base-uri BASE_URI] [--version] schema

arguments.name: schema
arguments.description: the path to a JSON Schema to validate with (i.e. schema.json)

options.name: --help
options.description: show this help message and exit

options.name: --instance
options.description: a path to a JSON instance (i.e. filename.json) to validate (may be specified multiple times). If no instances are provided via this option, one will be expected on standard input.

options.name: --error-format
options.description: the format to use for each validation error message, specified in a form suitable for str.format. This string will be passed one formatted object named 'error' for each ValidationError. Only provide this option when using --output=plain, which is the default. If this argument is unprovided and --output=plain is used, a simple default representation will be used.

options.name: --output
options.description: an output format to use. 'plain' (default) will produce minimal text with one line for each error, while 'pretty' will produce more detailed human-readable output on multiple lines.

options.name: --validator
options.description: the fully qualified object name of a validator to use, or, for validators that are registered with jsonschema, simply the name of the class.

options.name: --base-uri
options.description: a base URI to assign to the provided schema, even if it does not declare one (via e.g. $id). This option can be used if you wish to resolve relative references to a particular URI (or local path)

options.name: --version
options.description: show program's version number and exit
